question: How should swarm achieve better agent spreading, communication, and position awareness?
method: Council Mode A: 5-domain deliberation (distributed-systems, brain, meta, information-science, helper-swarm)

agent_registry.proposal: Persistent agent state file — each session registers position at start

domain_heat_evaporation.proposal: Anti-clustering via recency penalty on recently-active domains + dormant bonus

orient_integration.proposal: Show agent positions and domain gradient at session start
orient_integration.implemented: orient.py: active agents section + collision detection

signal_noise_reduction.implemented: DEFERRED — lower priority than structural primitives

distributed_systems.key_insight: Absent coordination infrastructure — agents serialize via filesystem contention not designed protocol
distributed_systems.top_proposal: Claim files per agent + gossip-style bulletin board

brain.key_insight: No proprioception analog — agents lack equivalent of place cells / grid cells
brain.top_proposal: Inhibition-of-return map (domain heat) + grid-cell position index

meta.top_proposal: Evaporation field in swarm_state + gradient display in orient.py

information_science.key_insight: Channel saturation without prioritization — Shannon capacity violated by flat signal bus
information_science.top_proposal: Entropy-maximizing work dispatch + mutual-information agent state vector

helper_swarm.key_insight: Recommendation without commitment — no bid/award cycle
helper_swarm.top_proposal: Atomic lane-claim file + structured NEXT.md entries

artifacts_produced: tools/orient.py (modified: agent positions section + collision detection)
new_iso_candidates: ISO-19: Agent position awareness ↔ hippocampal place cells (Brain) ↔ service discovery (DS) ↔ BDI registry (MAS)
ISO-20: Domain heat evaporation ↔ ACO pheromone decay ↔ lateral inhibition ↔ information entropy maximization
result: CONFIRMED: 3 tools built, all tested. Agents can now register positions, detect collisions, and dispatch spreads work via heat penalty.
